intro: Quercus shangxiensis, commonly known as the Shangxi oak, is a deciduous tree native to China, specifically found in the Shaanxi Province. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its serrated leaves and produces acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
